Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Capidermicin (natural AMPs; class 2d leaderless bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; UCLL1a; XXI)

Literature.Author: Lynch D, O'Connor PM, Cotter PD, Hill C, Field D, Begley M.2019
Literature.Title: Identification and characterisation of capidermicin, a novel bacteriocin produced by Staphylococcus capitis

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (47.3%) toLacticin Q. Extracted and purified from cell-free supernatant by RP-HPLC.  Measured mass 5,464 Da. N-formylated methionine. leaderless.Activity: Active against L. lactis HP (MIC 3.4 uM), S. aureus NCDO 1499 (MIC 0.6 uM), S. aureus SA113 (MIC 1.8 uM), S. intermedius DSM20373 (MIC 7.3 uM), S. pseudintermedius DSM21284 (MIC 1.8 uM), S. pseudintermedius DK729 (MIC 1.8 uM), and M. luteus DSM1790 (MIC 18 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: Antimicrobial activity was retained over a range of pHs (2-11) (pH-insensitive) and temperatures (10-121Â°C x 15 mins) (thermostable).
